text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make my focaccia rules
they are incredibly simple to make I
used to make these so so many times when
I had the restaurant with my dad because
these were the rules that we served all
of our sandwiches on and everybody loves
them they couldn't be easier to make so
I'm really excited to show you this
recipe so before we get started let's go
over the ingredients
we're going to use some pizza dough
either whole wheat or white flour does
not matter some garlic some dried
rosemary extra virgin olive oil salt and
pepper now at the restaurant we made our
own pizza dough so every morning we
would make sheet pans full of these
rolls because like I said we served all
of our sandwiches on them but you know
for me it's easier to buy pizza dough at
the grocery store or I like to go to my
favorite pizza shop and just ask to buy
it a couple doulton a couple of balls of
dough and though doesn't that two bucks
poppy a piece and I don't have to make
my own dough but if you want to make
your own pizza dough go check out my
pizza episode and they'll show you there
how to make homemade pizza dough but for
now I'm using the store for some help
now what we're going to do first is make
the garlic word I'm going to brush over
the top and you can make this in a
blender or you can make this in a food
processor I'm just going to do it by
hand really really quickly by grating
the garlic and a little tiny Bowl that's
great you're looking for the garlic to
be almost like a paste and if you don't
have a little grater like that you can
just use a knife and just you know chop
until it's really really fine and then
you're going to add in some olive oil
just enough to make it nice and thick
and tastes like that it's about right so
that's done your garlic part is done so
now I'm going to work on the dough first
let me clean this olive oil up so my
dough doesn't stick and now I'm just
going to sprinkle some flour on my work
surface here so that the dough does not
stick so that looks good I also have a
sheet pan here with some parchment paper
ready for my rolls to go on top of
now here's how it goes take the dough
which I put some flour on the plate as
well so I didn't stick take your pizza
dough and this is a one pound ball of
pizza dough flatten it with your hands
and then I like to use a pastry cutter
like this but you can use a knife you
can use anything you want and I'm going
to make four rolls out of here
I'm not going to be pretty big so that's
great
shake off any excess flour put them on
the baking sheet like so and now I'm
just going to take a sharp knife and
make just a few slits over the top we
used to use like a little razor at the
restaurant but a sharp knife does the
job just as well and then you take a
pastry brush and your garlic oil and you
brush that garlic oil all over the top
of each roll last one and then I like to
just sprinkle some dried rosemary and
I'm telling you this is exactly what we
used to do at the restaurant so what
you're seeing here is what I did every
morning for a good hour so because we
needed you know hundreds and hundreds of
rolls this is just a much thinner
smaller scale and then just some black
pepper and a touch of salt on each one
not too too much so that'll do wait that
one don't really get much now all I'm
going to do is cover this with some
plastic wrap and I'm going to let this
sit somewhere warm
for about 45 minutes to an hour or until
they've kind of puffed up and risen a
little bit and I'll show you what that
looks like once they're there now and
let these rise a little bit in a warm
place for about 45 minutes and now I'm
going to bake them in a 400 degree
preheated oven for about 15 minutes or
so or until they're lightly golden on
the top in the bottom these baked for 15
minutes at 400 as you can see they're
perfect I'm a little bit scared to dig
into them because they just came out of
the oven and I know they're gonna be
really hot but I just want to show you
what the inside looks like look how
fluffy that is see steam that is amazing
it's got a nice crust on the outside
super fluffy on the inside give us a
quick bite and good stuff mmm
you can serve this with anything mmm so
good you can serve this with absolutely
anything what I plan to do with them is
to make like a chicken chicken breast
with pesto and melted mozzarella and
tomato it's going to be one heck of a
sandwich that I can't wait to sink my
teeth into but this is just an
all-purpose roll but you can make every
couple days in your house to have fresh
bread and this is a substitute for any
rolls I've ever used all are in the
kitchen if you have these on hand you
can substitute whatever I use and learn
the kitchen for example four cheese
sticks if you can't find crusty rolls
you can use this which we use - if you
can find you know burger buttons for
example you can use this bread it's just
an all-purpose bread that you can make
no time at all with just a little bit of
a help from the supermarket buy bit by
buying the pizza dough already made but
if you've got time on your hands go
ahead and make your own pizza dough I
salute you for that good for you good
job making your own pizza dough but
that's it I hope you enjoyed spending
